notes: Guhle is out for Thursday's (Dec. 5) game against Nashville.
The Islanders said that Varlamov is day-to-day and is OUT for Thursday's (Dec. 5) game versus the Kraken.
The Predators announced that O'Reilly is week-to-week with a lower-body injury.
The Nashville Predators placed D Jeremy Lauzon on injured reserve.
Kucherov is OUT for Thursday's (Dec. 5) game versus San Jose, Gabby Shirley of FanDuel Sports Network Florida & Sun reports.
Matinpalo is out for Thursday's (Dec. 5) game against Detroit.
McCabe is OUT for Friday's (Dec. 6) game against Washington, according to Mark Masters of TSN.
Deslauriers is out for Thursday's (Dec. 5) game against Florida.
The Los Angeles Kings placed F Trevor Lewis on injured reserve on Wednesday (Dec. 4).
Stecher suffered an apparent ear injury when he was struck by a puck in the third period of Tuesday's (Dec. 3) game versus the Golden Knights, Daniel Nugent-Bowman of The Athletic reports.
Faulk is out for Thursday's (Dec. 5) game against Calgary.
Haula wasn't able to practice on Tuesday (Dec. 3) and is being evaluated for an undisclosed injury, per Amanda Stein of the Devils' official site.
The Sabres announced that Dahlin is OUT for Thursday's (Dec. 5) game against Winnipeg and is without a timeline to return.
Talbot will not be available for Detroit's current road trip in Boston and Ottawa, according to Helene St. James of the Detroit Free Press.

Seguin will be out of action for 4-6 months when he undergoes surgery on Thursday (Dec. 5) for a left-side femoral acetabular impingement and hip labrum, per Lia Assimakopoulos of The Dallas Morning News.
Bobrovsky is probable for Saturday's (Dec. 7) game against the Sharks.
Evans is out for Thursday's (Dec. 5) game against the Islanders.
Berard did not play in Monday's (Dec. 2) game against New Jersey.
The Winnipeg Jets placed F Nikolaj Ehlers on injured reserve on Tuesday (Dec. 3).
The Flames announced that Kirkland underwent successful ACL surgery on Wednesday (Dec. 4) and he will be out for the remainder of the season.
Chinakhov did not accompany Columbus on the team's five-game road trip and won't play on Sunday (Dec. 8) versus Chicago, per Jeff Svoboda of the Blue Jackets' official site.
Tatar did not play in Monday's (Dec. 2) game against the Rangers.
The Utah Hockey Club said on Saturday (Nov. 30) that Lamoureux was placed on injured reserve.
The Los Angeles Kings placed F Akil Thomas on injured reserve on Friday (Nov. 29).
Avalanche head coach Jared Bednar said on Monday (Dec. 2) that Kylington is considered week-to-week, per Bailey Curtis of The Hockey News.
The Buffalo Sabres placed F Sam Lafferty on injured reserve.
The Colorado Avalanche placed D Josh Manson on injured reserve.
The Colorado Avalanche placed F Miles Wood on injured reserve. He is considered month-to-month, Evan Rawal of the Denver Gazette reports.
The Vancouver Canucks placed D Filip Hronek on injured reserve on Thursday (Dec. 5).
The Minnesota Wild said that Brodin is regarded as week-to-week on Wednesday (Dec. 4).
The Detroit Red Wings placed G Alex Lyon on injured reserve on Monday (Dec. 2).
The Minnesota Wild placed F Jakub Lauko on injured reserve on Tuesday (Dec. 3).
The San Jose Sharks placed F Barclay Goodrow on injured reserve on Thursday (Nov. 28).
McMann is progressing in his recovery but won't play in the Leafs' next two games after head coach Craig Berube told reporters on Thursday (Dec. 5), per Mark Masters of TSN.
The Ottawa Senators placed D Artem Zub on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Nov. 26).
Chaffee has been ruled out for Thursday's (Dec. 5) game against San Jose, Gabby Shirley of FanDuel Sports Network Florida & Sun reports.
The Senators said on Tuesday (Dec. 3) that Perron is not expected to be back in the short term, per TSN 1200 Ottawa.
Avalanche head coach Jared Bednar announced Drouin is out for Wednesday's (Nov. 27) game against Vegas and is considered week to week.
The Nashville Predators announced on Wednesday (Nov. 27) D Jeremy Lauzon is considered week-to-week, per Robby Stanley of NHL.com.
Carlsson did not play in Wednesday's (Dec. 4) game against the Golden Knights.
The Winnipeg Jets placed D Dylan Samberg on injured reserve on Sunday (Nov. 24).
Whitecloud did not play in Wednesday's (Dec. 4) game against Anaheim.
Domi participated in Tuesday's (Dec. 3) practice and is close to being available to return to the lineup, according to David Alter of The Hockey News.
Ingram is not close to returning to the lineup, according to Cole Bagley of KSL Sports.
Kampf was moved to long-term injured reserve and will be unavailable until at least Thursday (Dec. 14) against the Red Wings, David Alter of The Hockey News reports.
Hutton is skating on his own but is not ready to join the team yet, per Jesse Granger of The Athletic.
Miller will take an indefinite leave of absence from the Canucks for personal reasons.
The Anaheim Ducks placed F Brock McGinn on injured reserve.
Ovechkin is skating on his own in a non-contact jersey on Wednesday (Dec. 4), Sammi Silber of The Hockey News reports.
Jones is expected to miss approximately four weeks with a right foot injury, per Charlie Roumeliotis of WGN Radio.
Leafs head coach Craig Berube announced on Thursday (Dec. 5) that Hakanpaa recently underwent a procedure on his knee that should allow him to resume skating soon, per David Alter of The Hockey News.
The Anaheim Ducks placed D Urho Vaakanainen on injured reserve.
The Los Angeles Kings placed D Caleb Jones on injured reserve on Friday (Nov. 15).
Greenway underwent a procedure for his mid-body injury on Tuesday (Nov. 26), per Heather Engel of NHL.com.
The Minnesota Wild placed F Mats Zuccarello on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Dec. 3).
The Seattle Kraken placed F Jordan Eberle on long-term injured reserve on Saturday (Nov. 30).
Samuelsson resumed skating on Friday (Nov. 29), Bill Hoppe of the Olean Times Herald reports. He has no clear timetable yet for his return.
Lindholm remains week-to-week, according to Conor Ryan of The Boston Globe. He is still on injured reserve and isn't close to being available to return.
Arvidsson has no timeline to return to the Oilers' lineup, per Radio Color Commentator Bob Stauffer.
Fabbri had surgery on Friday (Nov. 15) and is expected to be out for approximately six weeks, per Helene St. James of the Detroit Free Press.
Pacioretty participated in Tuesday's (Dec. 3) practice and is progressing toward a potential return to the lineup, per David Alter of The Hockey News. He still remains on long-term injured reserve.
Stone did not play in Wednesday's (Dec. 4) game against Anaheim.
Drysdale skated in a non-contact jersey during Monday's (Nov. 18) practice, per Jordan Hall of NBC Sports Philadelphia. He has no clear timeline for his return.
The Washington Capitals shifted F Sonny Milano to long-term injured reserve, Stephen Whyno of the Associated Press reports.
The Vancouver Canucks placed D Derek Forbort on injured reserve, per the NHL media site.
The Flames announced that Mantha will require surgery on his ACL on Thursday (Nov. 14) and will miss the remainder of the 2024-25 season.
The New Jersey Devils placed F Nathan Bastian on long-term injured reserve on Monday (Nov. 18).
The Islander said that Pelech looks to be making strides in his recovery but won't be available to return to the lineup until he is cleared for contact.
The Islanders said that Reilly will have a procedure on his heart on Tuesday (Nov. 19). He will be out indefinitely.
Barzal was placed on long-term injured reserve on Saturday (Nov. 2), per Andrew Gross of Newsday, and is expected to miss 4-6 weeks.
Colton was placed on long-term injured reserve on Monday (Dec. 2), per PuckPedia.
The Hurricanes announced that Andersen will undergo a procedure on his knee on Friday (Nov. 22 )which will knock him out of action about 8 weeks or so, per TSN and RDS Hockey Insider Pierre LeBrun.
The New Jersey Devils placed F Curtis Lazar on injured reserve on Monday (Nov. 18).
Duclair has begun skating on his own on Friday (Nov. 29), per Stefen Rosner of NHL.com.
Leddy will accompany the Blues on the team's upcoming four-game road trip, per Lou Korac of NHL.com.
The Blue Jackets announced that Gudbranson underwent successful shoulder surgery on Monday (Oct. 21) and is without a timetable to return.
The Utah Hockey Club announced D Sean Durz has undergone successful shoulder surgery and is expected to return in 4-6 months.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Jakub Demek on the injured reserve non-roster list.
The Colorado Avalanche placed D Tucker Poolman on long-term injured reserve. He didn't play in 2023-24 due to migraines and won't be available for the 2024-25 campaign either.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed D Lukas Cormier on injured reserve non-roster list on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Jordan Gustafson on injured reserve non-roster list on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Boston Bruins placed D Alec Regula on injured reserve non-roster list, per Mark Divver of the New England Hockey Journal.
The Columbus Blue Jackets placed F Jordan Dumais on injured reserve.
The Philadelphia Flyers placed D Ryan Ellis on injured reserve.
Jenner underwent shoulder surgery on Wednesday (Oct. 9) and could return before the end of the season, per Jeff Svoboda of the Blue Jackets' official site.
The Leafs said Jarnkrok had surgery to repair a sports hernia and is now considered month-to-month.

Grosenick underwent successful surgery on Wednesday (Oct. 2) to repair a torn ACL in his right knee and will not play this season. He is expected to make a full recovery and be ready for the start of the 2025-26 season.
The Canadiens said that Reinbacher underwent surgery to his left knee on Tuesday (Oct. 1) and is out for 5-to-6 months.
The Nashville Predators placed F Austin Roest on injured reserve non-roster list on Sunday (Sept. 29).
The Devils said that Hatakka underwent successful shoulder surgery on Thursday (Oct. 10) and is without a timetable to return.
Doughty is aiming to return to action in early January as long as there are no setbacks in his recovery, per Dennis Bernstein of The Fourth Period.
Kaliyev will be out of action for 6-8 weeks, per Kings' general manager Rob Blake.
Demko is making strides in his recovery on Tuesday (Nov. 26) and could be a game-time decision sooner rather than later, Iain MacIntyre of Sportsnet reports.
The Utah Hockey Club said on Wednesday (Oct. 23) that Marino underwent successful surgery and is expected to return in 3-4 months.
Couture has not resumed skating on Friday (Nov. 1) and remains without a timeline to return, per Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now.
Vlasic is out for Thursday's (Dec. 5) game against the Lightning.
The Edmonton Oilers placed F Evander Kane on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Oct. 8).

The Capitals said on Wednesday (Sept. 18) that Oshie will be put on long-term injured reserve due to a chronic back injury which is expected to cost him the entire 2024-25 campaign, per Tom Gulitti of NHL.com.
The St. Louis Blues placed D Torey Krug on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Carolina Hurricanes placed F Jesper Fast on long-term injured reserve.
Brossoit had another procedure done on Friday (Nov. 29) and is expected to be out for another six weeks, according to Blackhawks head coach Luke Richardson.
The San Jose Sharks placed F Igor Chernyshov on injured reserve on Monday (Oct. 7).
The Washington Capitals placed F Nicklas Backstrom on long-term injured reserve.
Avalanche head coach Jared Bednar said that Landeskog remains without a timetable to return, per Adrian Hernandez of SBNation.com.
